name: zazie von einem anderen stern // regen:tropfen
description: regen:tropfen is the debut album by contemporary classical solo pianist maike zazie matern aka "zazie von einem anderen stern regen:tropfen was recorded in a small little room with a south facing garden view in berlin-neukölln & on a piano at nils frahm's durtonstudio in berlin-wedding in spring and summer 2009. including . intro . morgen . raum ohne zeit . regentropfen . ölandsvisa . im juli . klavierregen . zwischen meinen händen . nachtschwärmen . nacht. outro . all music written & played by maike zazie matern. "matern’s mastery of the piano and her classical training are highlighted, the melodies are deep and powerful, as well as possessing an exceptional beauty. regen:tropfen is an exquisite modern classical work which introduces maike zazie matern as an exceptional talent whose star is surely on the rise." adam williams for [www.fluid-radio.co.uk] "The resulting album [regen:tropfen] is a masterpiece. [...] Hearing an album as original as regen:tropfen helps to remind one that there are still unexplored regions of music to be pioneered. Matern is just the kind of girl we want at the head of that expedition, too [...]." robin babb for [www.spacecityrock.com] "there’s something incredibly warm and inviting about regen:tropfen, like trailing your hands in a stream on a warm day." joshua meggitt for [www.cyclicdefrost.com] "ms. zazie has a way with creating the most hauntingly brilliant minimalist structures. and out of their cold 'absent-lifed' tone's she brings warmth, profound beauty, and overall understanding of the importance of each and every 'small aspect' from life as we know it. " [www.everythingischemical.blogspot.com] "een onwaarschijnlijk mooi droomdebuut." jan willem broek for [www.subjectivisten.nl/caleidoscoop] Format // CD Record Label // Drifting Falling Catalogue Number // DRIFTING018
